claim: People in middle school usually get breast exams.

supporting.text: Breast exams are typically recommended for adult women, not middle school-aged children.

attacks.text: Breast exams are typically recommended for adult women, not middle school-aged children.
Some middle school students may develop early signs of breast conditions that require examination.
Early breast examinations in middle school are not standard practice and lack clinical guidelines.

supporting.text: Medical guidelines do not include routine breast exams for middle school students as standard practice.

attacks.text: Medical guidelines do not include routine breast exams for middle school students as standard practice.
Some middle schools may provide optional health screenings that include breast exams as part of broader wellness programs.
Optional screenings are not routine and do not represent standard medical practice for middle school students.
In rare cases, middle school students with specific risk factors may be advised to undergo breast exams by their physicians.
Such cases are exceptions and do not justify the claim that middle school students 'usually' get breast exams.

supporting.text: Middle school students are generally pre-pubescent or early pubescent, making breast exams medically unnecessary.

attacks.text: Middle school students are generally pre-pubescent or early pubescent, making breast exams medically unnecessary.
Some middle school students, especially those aged 13-14, may already be in mid-to-late puberty, making breast exams potentially relevant for early detection of abnormalities.
Even for pubescent middle school students, routine breast exams are not standard medical practice unless symptoms or family history indicate a need.
Breast exams in middle school could be part of general health education rather than medical necessity, promoting awareness of bodily changes.
Health education in middle school typically focuses on broader topics like hygiene and nutrition, not specific clinical exams like breast checks.

supporting.text: Pediatric care focuses on general health and development, not specialized exams like breast screenings for this age group.

attacks.text: Pediatric care focuses on general health and development, not specialized exams like breast screenings for this age group.
Some middle school students may require breast exams due to early puberty or specific health concerns.
Even in cases of early puberty, breast exams are not routine and are only conducted if symptoms or abnormalities are present.
Schools or local health programs sometimes provide general health screenings that may include breast exams.
Such programs are rare and typically require parental consent, making them exceptions rather than the norm.
